instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1465: What is A1465? A1465 is a model number for a 11 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2924, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00164, 820-3208, 820-3435..
definitions.820-3435: What is 820-3435? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_REG: What is PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_REG? This is battery power that flows to the system AFTER it has gone through a current sense resistor, before it goes through a fuse to become PPBUS_G3H power rail. .

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b no enciende
threads.message:
hola migo, espero me puedas ayudar a solucionar este macbook, me lo trajeron porque no enciende, al revisarlo note corrocion en <CHIP>U3210</CHIP>, faltaban las resistencias de los pin 9 y 10 ya las tiene de nuevo, tenia un corto en <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>, era el condensador <CAPACITOR>C1204</CAPACITOR>, lo reemplace y ya no tiene corto, pero sigue sin encender, 
Aqui las mediciones que he echo:
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> = 2.5V
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 8.60V
<SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_REG</SIGNAL> = 8.60V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> = 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> = 0V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> = 0.52V

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b no enciende
threads.message:
Quizas tengas un problema con <CHIP>U8020</CHIP>.
Si la tension de entrada y activacion estan bien, prueba cambiarlo.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b no enciende
threads.message: ese era el problema, ya enciende, solo que se descarga muy rapido, y al encender el ventilador gira y luego se apaga y luego vuelve a girar 2 veces mas y luego se mantiene

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b no enciende
threads.message: That is normal behavior for 3435/37 boards; two restarts, before booting.
